instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Hi,

I am working on an 820-00239-A. Charger was stuck at 5V, after replacing UB400 I'm getting 20V 0,0A on other 3 ports, the port UB400 is responsible for is still stuck at 5V.
PPBUS_G3H is 0.77v. 
PP3V3_G3H is 3.4v.

Can UB400 be responsible for PPBUS_G3H not being created properly?

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Post diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H first.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: diode mode PPBUS_G3H to ground is 0.422V

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: There should be U7000 issue; post its basic voltages.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Thank you for your time so far.

The voltages I could measure are:

PM_EN_P3V3_G3H 5.00V
PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG 0.776V
PPVBAT_G3H_CONN 0.776V
TBA_BGATE 0.2mV
TBA_BOOT1 4.70V
TBA_BOOT2 4,74V
TBA_CSO_N 0.776V
TBA_CSO_P 0.776V
TBA_GATE_Q1 2.8mV
TBA_GATE_Q2 0V
TBA_GATE_Q3 0V
TBA_GATE_Q4 2.8mV
TBA_LX1 2.8mV
TBA_LX2 2.8mV

I then accidentally shorted SMC_RST_L and PP3V3_G3H at R7009 and R7090 while measuring.
Now PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is missing so I think I fried U7000.

I already ordered a replacement for U7000 and have to wait for it.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Sorry to hear that.
Pay more atention when you work on these new boards.

BTW, basic pins are P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, MPM_PBUS, VR1_3P3, EN_VR1, SMC_RST*, AUX_OK, CBC_ON, A/BMON.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Hi

I replaced U7000 now.

P_IN 20.17V
AUX_DET    5.01V
DDA 5.13 V
DDP 5.13V
MPM_PBUS 19.81V
VR1_3P3    3.327V
EN_VR1 5.12V
SMC_RST* 3.331V
AUX_OK 3.331V
AMON 15mV
BMON 2mV

for CBC_ON I could not find a probe point on the board view.

PPBUS_G3H is still 0.77v.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Post again diode mode at F7000.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
0V at F7000

Edit: or do you mean PPBUS_G3H to ground? That is 4.1V

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: I mean diode mode reading (no charger, nor battery connected); as ALWAYS, red probe at ground!

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: yes, I measured diode mode.  PPBUS_G3H to ground is 4.1V and diode mode between F7000 pads is 0V.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
I'm wondering how can you get 4.1V in diode mode :eek:.
Did you test with red probe at ground and black probe at PPBUS_G3H???
Disconnect charger and battery; allow 10s before diode mode test.

BTW, forget the "V" when you post diode mode reading.

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Sorry, I meant to write 0.41 and not 4.1. ?   It measures 0.41

threads.title: 820-00239-A 20v on PPDCIN_G3h_CHGR, 0.77v on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Remove F7000 and check voltage at R7060.
